sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Where amongst other persons discouered to bee confederates in the late horrible treason, for the destruction of our person and the whole estates of the realme, one Robert Winter, esquire, ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie., Imprinted at London : 1605.
For the apprehension of R. Winter and S. Littleton. Cf. STC. Dated at end: VVestminster the xviij. day of Nouember, in the third yeere of our reigne ... . Descriptions of Robert Winter and Stephen Litleton are given at the end of the text. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
Where amongst other persons discouered to bee confederates in the late horrible treason, for the destruction of our person and the whole estates of the realme, one Robert Winter, esquire, ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie., Imprinted at London : 1605.
For the apprehension of R. Winter and S. Littleton. Cf. STC. Dated at end: VVestminster the xviij. day of Nouember, in the third yeere of our reigne ... . Descriptions of Robert Winter and Stephen Litleton are given at the end of the text. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
the Kings most excellent Maiestie.
Robert Barker
